sub_title: Semiconductors | Photonics | Nanotechnologies | Medical devices | Research and Development | Process Engineering
summary:
Familiar with international, multi-cultural environments. Language skills include Italian, English, Portuguese, Spanish (little Catalan as well), and currently learning Dutch.
I am an Italian engineer, Master graduated, with 9 years of experience in research and development, and semiconductors process engineering. My background includes working in startups, small and medium enterprises, and international labs in various European countries.

In the past years, I have had the opportunity to work in a variety of industries, including semiconductors, photonics, spintronics, and medical devices.
Additionally, earlier in my career, I co-invented and patented a biomedical device, a portable kit - microfluidic lab-on-chip (LoC) for point-of-car (PoC) automated immunoenzymatic assays.

I have extensive technical skills in micro- and nanofabrication processes for device fabrication in cleanroom, including photolithography, wet, dry and plasma etching, different techniques for thin-film deposition (PVD and CVD), for silicon and III-V semiconductor manufacturing technology. Proficient in process improvement (SPC, DMAIC, Six Sigma, Cpk, KPI). Experienced in technology transfer, operations, project management, planning, and managing small teams. Six Sigma Green Belt.

I am highly passionate about science and technology, with a good understanding of business and management. Skilled in using digital tools and constantly seeking to improve personal growth and career development. Interested in staying up-to-date on emerging technologies in a variety of fields, including electronics, IT and communications, artificial intelligence, entertainment, optoelectronics, energy, materials, medicine, neuroscience, and space.

projects.title: Modeling of MicroCantilever Structures with COMSOL
projects.description:
ABSTRACT
In this work we present the design, analysis and simulation of microcantilevers of various shapes. The simulation is done by COMSOL Multiphysics and we investigate the changes in the sensitivity of the microcantilevers respect to change of their shapes for the same applied force and different forces and the displacement variations versus scaling of their lengths and thicknesses.
At the end, we developed a mathematical model to calculate some parameters of 'strange-shaped' microcantilevers.

projects.title: ELISE - Environment LIve SEnsing
projects.description:
The goal of ELISE  (Environment LIve SEnsing) project is to implement an ICT ecosystem based on the Internet-of-Things, Open Data and Big Data paradigms focusing on environmental issues.
The data related to air quality are gathered through a distributed and crowd-sourced network of low-costs sensors.
On one hand, the data are integrated into numerical simulations describing the diffusion of pollutants in a urban settings and visualized in comprehensive dashboards to provide actionable knowledge to decision makers. On the other hand, the citizens involved in the project have a near-real time feedback of their every day activity and pollutants exposure.
All the data collected with the sensors are streamed and stored on the Smart Data Net, a platform developed by Regione Piemonte with the aim of collecting and sharing data coming from the world of the connected things.
The adopted Living Lab approach brings together interdisciplinary experts to develop, deploy, and test - in actual living environments - new technologies and strategies for design that respond to this changing world. ELISE is adopting a participatory approach, involving hundreds of high-school students in the Turin area.
More than 100 sensors have been delivered to students. In about 3 weeks since the engagement of the students, ~70% of users use the app on daily basis with a total distance covered of 1276km.
The mobile app that sends the data collected by the mobile sensors to the central server is devised to engage the citizens and provide feedbacks about user’s activity and pollution exposures.
The level of pollution obtained integrating the data of mobile sensors with the numerical simulations can be visualized by policy makers through dedicated dashboards.

profile_positions.title: Visiting Laboratory Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Dept. Micro and Nanofabrication Facility
+ Responsible for part of the optical lithography area: tools and equipment management (SUSS, Singulus, Nordiko, SPTS), users training and process support, creating standard of operation, maintenance.
+ Device fabrication: MTJ (Magnetic Tunnel Junction) sensor device on 8" wafer fabrication, pilot line production, yield optimization.
+ Involved in research and development in micro- nanotechnology projects.
+ Micro and nanofabrication in cleanroom: silicon technology on 8" wafer, polymer processing.
+ Design of experiment, process optimization, collect-elaborate experimental data, report and present result.

profile_positions.description:
